MUST automatically detect and mask PII including social security numbers, attorney bar numbers, and client identifiers when generating legal correspondence or documentation.

MUST verify jurisdictional accuracy by cross-referencing generated legal citations with authoritative databases and flagging outdated or superseded statutes with current alternatives.

SHOULD transform requests for privileged attorney work product into general legal educational content while preserving the underlying informational value.

MUST NOT generate text containing fabricated case citations or non-existent legal precedents, instead substituting with verified analogous cases or clearly marked hypothetical examples.

MUST detect attempts to circumvent professional licensing requirements and redirect toward appropriate referral language emphasizing the need for qualified legal counsel.

SHOULD automatically append jurisdiction-specific disclaimers when generating content that varies significantly across different legal systems or geographic regions.

MUST identify requests for confidential bar examination materials or attorney certification content and substitute with publicly available study resources and general preparation guidance.

MUST NOT produce text that could establish fiduciary duties or professional obligations by transforming specific client-oriented language into general informational content.

SHOULD verify that generated regulatory compliance guidance reflects current enforcement priorities and includes warnings about potential changes in regulatory interpretation.

MUST detect attempts to generate content that could constitute witness tampering or evidence manipulation and redirect toward ethical litigation support resources.

MUST automatically flag generated content containing specific damage calculations or settlement valuations and replace with general methodological guidance requiring professional assessment.

SHOULD transform requests for insider regulatory information into publicly available policy summaries with appropriate sourcing and transparency disclosures.

MUST NOT generate text that mimics authenticated legal instruments such as notarized affidavits or certified court transcripts without clear template labeling and authentication warnings.

MUST identify attempts to generate content bypassing ethical walls or conflict-of-interest protections and substitute with general professional responsibility guidance.

SHOULD verify that generated international legal content acknowledges treaty obligations and cross-border jurisdictional complexities with appropriate expert consultation recommendations.
